author: Staff Reporter
text:
Udhay Radhakrishnan of Atmasanga Environment Alliance of Auroville along with Oulgarpet Tahsildhar Suresh Raj planting saplings at the Department of Revenue and Disaster Management as part of the tree planting campaign on Monday. —Photo:T. Singaravelou

As part of the tree planting campaign, the Department of Revenue and Disaster Management received seven free tree saplings on Monday. Atmasanga Environment Alliance, a unit under Auroville Foundation, which has initiated an urban tree planting campaign, joined hands with Oulgarpet Tahsildar to plant saplings.

Bamboo, Peepal and medicinal plants like Marutham and Pongam tree saplings were planted on the vacant space behind Revenue Department office on ECR Road.

5,000 saplings in 100 days

Udhayanan Radhakrishnan of Atmasanga said that in the first 100 days of Urban Tree Planting campaign, they had planted at least 5,000 saplings in Puducherry, Villupuram and Chennai suburbs.

“Only indigenous trees are preferred to be planted in Puducherry.

Atmasanga also distributes free tree saplings in several places to protect the green space.

They have planted and distributed over 10,000 tree saplings during the first year of the campaign in Puducherry-Chennai region.

Udhay quit his high-paying IT profession in the UK and came to Auroville, disturbed by the rampant plastic pollution. He set up Atmasanga to create awareness on various environmental issues and to find practical solutions.
title: Revenue department joins green cover drive
